results.question: List all employees in the Sales department
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id WHERE d.name = 'Sales' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many employees were hired in 2024?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM employees WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM hire_date) = 2024;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: What is the average salary by department?
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, AVG(e.salary) AS avg_salary FROM departments d JOIN employees e ON d.department_id = e.department_id GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all customers with credit limit over $100,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.* FROM customers c WHERE c.credit_limit > 100000;

results.question: How many sales orders are in pending status?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM sales_orders WHERE status = 'pending' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all products in the Electronics category
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.sku AS product_sku, p.name AS product_name FROM products p INNER JOIN product_categories pc ON p.category_id = pc.category_id WHERE pc.name = 'Electronics' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the names of all warehouses?
results.sql_generated: SELECT w.name FROM warehouses w LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all active vendors
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.* FROM vendors v WHERE v.is_active = TRUE LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different account types in the chart of accounts?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT at.name FROM account_types at JOIN chart_of_accounts ca ON at.type_id = ca.account_type_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all bank accounts and their current balances
results.sql_generated: SELECT b.account_number, b.current_balance FROM bank_accounts b LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many projects are currently active?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM projects WHERE status = 'active' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all fixed assets with their purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.asset_id AS asset_id, fa.name AS name, fa.purchase_cost AS purchase_cost FROM fixed_assets fa LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are all the available leave types?
results.sql_generated: SELECT lt.name FROM leave_types lt LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all training courses that are mandatory
results.sql_generated: SELECT tc.name AS course_name, tc.duration_hours, tc.cost FROM employee_training et JOIN training_courses tc ON et.course_id = tc.course_id WHERE tc.is_mandatory = TRUE LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different opportunity stages?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT stage_id FROM sales_opportunities LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all countries in the system
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.name AS country_name FROM countries c LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many departments are there?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM departments LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all units of measure
results.sql_generated: SELECT uom.name AS unit_measurement, uom.abbreviation, uom.conversion_factor FROM units_of_measure uom LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What fiscal years exist in the system?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT fy.year FROM fiscal_years fy LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different asset categories?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT a.category_id, ac.name FROM fixed_assets AS a JOIN asset_categories AS ac ON a.category_id = ac.category_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees who have been with the company for more than 5 years and earn above $100,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employees e JOIN employee_salaries s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id WHERE e.hire_date <= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '5 year' AND s.amount > 100000 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List employees and their managers' names
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id AS employee_id, e.first_name || ' ' || e.last_name AS employee_name, m.first_name || ' ' || m.last_name AS manager_name FROM employees e INNER JOIN employees m ON e.manager_id = m.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Which employees have pending leave requests?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employees e JOIN leave_requests lr ON e.employee_id = lr.employee_id WHERE lr.status = 'pending' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the number of employees per position title
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.title AS Position_Title, COUNT(e.employee_id) AS NumberOfEmployees FROM positions p JOIN employees e ON p.position_id = e.position_id GROUP BY p.title LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees with expiring certifications in the next 6 months
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employee_salaries s JOIN employees e ON s.employee_id = e.employee_id JOIN employee_certifications c ON e.employee_id = c.employee_id WHERE c.expiry_date BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '6 months') ORDER BY expiry_date ASC LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total sales amount by customer for 2024?
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id AS customer_id, SUM(sales_orders.total) AS total_sales FROM sales_orders JOIN customers ON sales_orders.customer_id = customers.customer_id WHERE YEAR(sales_orders.order_date) = 2024 GROUP BY c.customer_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: missing FROM-clause entry for table "c"

results.question: List the top 10 customers by total order value
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id, SUM(po.total) AS total_order_value FROM customers c INNER JOIN sales_orders po ON c.customer_id = po.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_id ORDER BY total_order_value DESC LIMIT 10;

results.question: Show sales opportunities in the Negotiation stage worth over $50,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT so.* FROM sales_opportunities AS so JOIN opportunity_stages AS os ON so.stage_id = os.stage_id WHERE os.name = 'Negotiation' AND so.amount > 50000 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the conversion rate from quotes to orders?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT quote_id) AS total_quotes, COUNT(order_id) AS total_orders FROM sales_orders JOIN order_lines ON sales_orders.order_id = order_lines.order_id JOIN quote_lines ON order_lines.line_id = quote_lines.line_id WHERE sales_orders.status = 'Completed' AND quote_lines.discount_percent > 0 LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column reference "quote_id" is ambiguous

results.question: List sales orders by sales representative with their totals
results.sql_generated: SELECT s.sales_rep_id AS rep_id, COUNT(s.order_id) AS total_orders FROM sales_orders s GROUP BY s.sales_rep_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Which products have inventory below their reorder point?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.sku AS product_sku, p.name AS product_name, i.quantity_available, rr.min_quantity, rr.reorder_quantity FROM products p INNER JOIN inventory_levels i ON p.product_id = i.product_id INNER JOIN reorder_rules rr ON p.product_id = rr.product_id WHERE i.quantity_available < rr.min_quantity LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show total inventory value by warehouse
results.sql_generated: SELECT w.warehouse_id, SUM(il.quantity * il.price) AS total_inventory_value FROM inventory_levels il JOIN warehouses w ON il.warehouse_id = w.warehouse_id JOIN warehouse_locations loc ON w.warehouse_id = loc.warehouse_id GROUP BY w.warehouse_id, loc.location_code LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column il.quantity does not exist

results.question: List products that had stock transfers in the last 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT p.* FROM products p INNER JOIN stock_transfers st ON p.product_id = st.product_id WHERE st.transfer_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days' AND p.is_active = TRUE LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column st.product_id does not exist

results.question: What is the total spend by vendor this year?
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.vendor_name, SUM(vi.amount) AS total_spend FROM vendor_invoices vi JOIN vendors v ON vi.vendor_id = v.vendor_id WHERE YEAR(fiscal_years.start_date) = fiscal_years.year GROUP BY v.vendor_name LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column v.vendor_name does not exist

results.question: List purchase orders that are overdue (expected date passed but not received)
results.sql_generated: SELECT po.* FROM purchase_orders AS po JOIN goods_receipts AS gr ON po.po_id = gr.receipt_id WHERE po.status <> 'Received' AND po.order_date < CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '1 day' ORDER BY po.order_date LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the approval rate for purchase requisitions
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(CASE WHEN status = 'approved' THEN 1 END) * 100.0 / COUNT(*) AS approval_rate FROM purchase_requisitions LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total debit and credit for each account in the current period?
results.sql_generated: SELECT b.account_number AS account_number, SUM(b.current_balance) AS total_debit, (SELECT SUM(t.amount) FROM bank_transactions t WHERE t.bank_account_id = b.bank_account_id AND t.transaction_date BETWEEN fp.start_date, fp.end_date) AS total_credit FROM bank_accounts b INNER JOIN fiscal_periods fp ON (SELECT MAX(fp.period_number) FROM fiscal_periods WHERE period_number = 102) = fp.period_number LEFT JOIN chart_of_accounts ca ON b.gl_account_id = ca.account_id GROUP BY b.account_number, fp.start_date, fp.end_date LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: syntax error at or near ","

results.question: List all posted journal entries for the current month
results.sql_generated: SELECT j.entry_id, j.entry_number, j.entry_date, j.period_id, j.description, j.status FROM journal_entries AS j JOIN fiscal_periods AS f ON j.period_id = f.id WHERE EXTRACT(MONTH FROM j.entry_date) = EXTRACT(MONTH FROM CURRENT_DATE) AND EXTRACT(YEAR FROM j.entry_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM CURRENT_DATE);
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Show budget vs actual spending by department
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, SUM(b.total_amount) AS total_budget, SUM(p.actual_amount) AS total_actual, (SUM(b.total_amount) - SUM(p.actual_amount)) AS budget_vs_actual FROM departments d JOIN budgets b ON d.department_id = b.department_id JOIN project_budgets p ON b.budget_id = p.budget_id GROUP BY d.name, b.total_amount, p.actual_amount LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total expense amount per project?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.project_id AS project_id, SUM(pe.amount) AS total_expenses FROM projects p JOIN project_expenses pe ON p.project_id = pe.project_id GROUP BY p.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List projects that are over budget
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.* FROM projects p INNER JOIN budgets b ON p.project_id = b.budget_id WHERE p.status = 'over budget' AND p.budget > b.total_amount LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show project resources and their allocation percentages
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.project_id AS project_id, r.employee_id AS employee_id, r.role AS role, r.allocation_percent AS allocation_percent FROM project_resources r JOIN projects p ON r.project_id = p.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List fixed assets by category with their total purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.category_id, SUM(fa.purchase_cost) AS total_purchase_cost FROM fixed_assets fa JOIN asset_categories ac ON fa.category_id = ac.category_id GROUP BY fa.category_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List assets due for maintenance in the next 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.* FROM fixed_assets AS fa JOIN asset_maintenance AS am ON fa.asset_id = am.asset_id WHERE am.status = 'scheduled' AND (am.completed_date IS NULL OR am.completed_date > CURRENT_DATE) AND am.cost >= 500 ORDER BY am.completed_date ASC LIMIT 30;

results.question: How many documents are attached to each entity type?
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.entity_type, COUNT(d.attachment_id) AS document_count FROM document_attachments d GROUP BY d.entity_type LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate employee turnover rate by department for 2024
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, (COUNT(e.employee_id) FILTER (WHERE e.termination_date IS NOT NULL AND YEAR(e.termination_date) = 2024)) / COUNT(d.department_id) * 100 AS turnover_rate FROM departments d LEFT JOIN employees e ON d.employee_id = e.department_id GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column d.employee_id does not exist

results.question: Find the salary percentile ranking for each employee within their department
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, d.name AS department_name, p.title, s.amount, NTILE(100) OVER (PARTITION BY d.department_id ORDER BY s.amount) AS salary_percentile FROM employees e INNER JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id INNER JOIN positions p ON e.position_id = p.position_id LEFT JOIN employee_salaries s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id WHERE e.is_active = true AND p.is_active = true LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Identify employees who have not completed mandatory training
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employees e JOIN employee_training et ON e.employee_id = et.employee_id WHERE et.status = 'completed' AND et.is_mandatory = TRUE LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column et.is_mandatory does not exist

results.question: Calculate month-over-month sales growth rate for the past 12 months
results.sql_generated: SELECT DATE_TRUNC('month', so.order_date) AS order_month, SUM(so.total) AS total_sales, LAG(SUM(so.total)) OVER (ORDER BY DATE_TRUNC('month', so.order_date)) AS previous_month_sales FROM sales_orders so WHERE so.status = 'completed' AND so.order_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '1 year' GROUP BY order_month ORDER BY order_month LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find the average order value and order frequency for each customer segment based on credit limit
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.segment, AVG(sales_orders.total) AS avg_order_value, COUNT(*) / 365.0 AS order_frequency FROM customers c JOIN sales_orders ON customers.customer_id = sales_orders.customer_id GROUP BY c.segment LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: invalid reference to FROM-clause entry for table "customers"

results.question: What is the sales pipeline weighted value by stage and expected close month?
results.sql_generated: SELECT opportunity_stages.name AS stage, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM actual_close_date) AS month, SUM((sales_opportunities.amount * opportunity_stages.probability / 100) + (purchase_orders.subtotal * sales_opportunities.probability / 100)) AS weighted_value FROM sales_opportunities INNER JOIN opportunity_stages ON sales_opportunities.stage_id = opportunity_stages.id LEFT JOIN purchase_orders ON sales_opportunities.po_id = purchase_orders.id LEFT JOIN vendor_invoice_lines ON purchase_orders.po_line_id = vendor_invoice_lines.po_line_id INNER JOIN sales_quotes ON sales_opportunities.quote_id = sales_quotes.id WHERE opportunity_stages.is_closed =;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Calculate inventory turnover ratio by product category
results.sql_generated: SELECT pc.category_id, SUM(il.quantity_available) / AVG(p.unit_cost) AS avg_inventory_turnover_ratio FROM inventory_levels il JOIN products p ON il.product_id = p.product_id JOIN product_categories pc ON p.category_id = pc.category_id GROUP BY pc.category_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Identify products with significant inventory discrepancies (adjustment > 10% of stock)
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name, i.quantity_available, a.quantity_change FROM products p INNER JOIN inventory_levels i ON p.product_id = i.product_id INNER JOIN adjustment_lines a ON p.product_id = a.product_id WHERE ABS(i.quantity_available - (a.quantity_before + a.quantity_after)) / i.quantity_available > 0.1 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate vendor performance score based on on-time delivery and invoice accuracy
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.vendor_id, AVG(CASE WHEN iv.due_date >= iv.invoice_date THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS on_time_delivery_score, AVG(CASE WHEN iv.amount_paid = iv.total THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS invoice_accuracy_score FROM vendors v JOIN vendor_invoices iv ON v.vendor_id = iv.vendor_id GROUP BY v.vendor_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Generate a trial balance for the current period showing debits and credits by account category
results.sql_generated: SELECT ac.name AS category, SUM(CASE WHEN da.type = 'debit' THEN da.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_debits, SUM(CASE WHEN da.type = 'credit' THEN da.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_credits FROM asset_categories ac JOIN depreciation_entries da ON ac.category_id = da.asset_id GROUP BY ac.name LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column da.type does not exist

results.question: Calculate cash flow from bank transactions grouped by transaction type and month
results.sql_generated:
SELECT transaction_type, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM transaction_date) AS month, SUM(amount * (1 - is_reconciled)) OVER (PARTITION BY transaction_type, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM transaction_date)) as cash_flow 
FROM bank_transactions 
JOIN bank_accounts ON bank_transactions.bank_account_id = bank_accounts.bank_account_id 
GROUP BY transaction_type, month;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Calculate project profitability comparing budget vs actual expenses
results.sql_generated: SELECT pb.project_id, SUM(pb.planned_amount) AS planned_total, SUM(pe.actual_amount) AS actual_total, (SUM(pb.planned_amount) - SUM(pe.actual_amount)) AS profitability FROM project_budgets pb INNER JOIN project_expenses pe ON pb.project_id = pe.project_id GROUP BY pb.project_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column pe.actual_amount does not exist

results.question: Find resource allocation by employee across all active projects
results.sql_generated: SELECT pr.employee_id AS EmployeeID, SUM(pr.allocation_percent * pe.amount) AS TotalResourceAllocation FROM project_resources pr JOIN task_assignments ta ON pr.employee_id = ta.employee_id AND pr.project_id = ta.task_id JOIN project_expenses pe ON pr.project_id = pe.project_id GROUP BY pr.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all fixed assets with their assigned employees and current locations
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.*, e.employee_id AS employee_assigned, la.name AS location_name FROM fixed_assets fa LEFT JOIN asset_locations la ON fa.location_id = la.location_id LEFT JOIN employees e ON fa.assigned_to = e.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Create a comprehensive employee cost report including salary and benefits by department
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, SUM(e.salary) + COALESCE(SUM(b.amount), 0) AS total_cost FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id LEFT JOIN employee_salaries s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: missing FROM-clause entry for table "b"
